member.name: IOleClientSite.GetContainer
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the object's container.
member.param: Address of pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the container object. If an error occurs, the implementation must set ppContainer to NULL.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The client site is in an OLE 1 container.
The container does not implement the interface.

member.name: IOleClientSite.GetMoniker
member.summary: Retrieves a moniker for the object's client site. An object can force the assignment of its own or its container's moniker by specifying a value for dwAssign.
member.param: Specifies whether to get a moniker only if one already exists, force assignment of a moniker, create a temporary moniker, or remove a moniker that has been assigned. In practice, you will usually request that the container force assignment of the moniker. Possible values are taken from the enumeration.

Specifies whether to return the container's moniker, the object's moniker relative to the container, or the object's full moniker. In practice, you will usually request the object's full moniker. Possible values are taken from the enumeration.

A pointer to an pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the moniker for the object's client site. If an error occurs, the implementation must set ppmk to NULL. Each time a container receives a call to IOleClientSite.GetMoniker, it must increase the reference count on the ppmk pointer it returns. It is the caller's responsibility to call when it is finished with the pointer.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: This container cannot assign monikers to objects. This is the case with OLE 1 containers.

member.name: IOleClientSite.OnShowWindow
member.summary: Notifies a container when an embedded object's window is about to become visible or invisible. This method does not apply to an object that is activated in place and therefore has no window separate from that of its container.
member.param: Indicates whether an object's window is open (TRUE) or closed (FALSE).
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: IOleClientSite.RequestNewObjectLayout
member.summary: Asks a container to resize the display site for embedded objects.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: Client site does not support requests for new layout.

member.name: IOleClientSite.SaveObject
member.summary: Saves the embedded object associated with the client site. This function is synchronous; by the time it returns, the save will be completed.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleClientSite.ShowObject
member.summary: Asks a container to display its object to the user. This method ensures that the container itself is visible and not minimized.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: Client site is in an OLE 1 container.

summary.para: Provides the primary means by which an embedded object obtains information about the location and extent of its display site, its moniker, its user interface, and other resources provided by its container. An object server calls IOleClientSite to request services from the container. A container must provide one instance of IOleClientSite for every compound-document object it contains.
summary.div: Note This interface is not supported for use across machine boundaries.
